programme.title: Corner Gas
programme.desc: It's the eve of Brent's 40th birthday; to celebrate, the town has planned a midnight party complete with fireworks and a parade.

programme.title: Corner Gas
programme.desc: Lacey is the unlikely champion of an eating contest; Emma enjoys the pleasures of an MP3 player.

programme.title: Transplant
programme.desc: As Bash's future at the hospital hangs in the balance, he diagnoses a young patient with a rare disease that could have been prevented; Mags is faced with a case she cannot solve, as June tries to keep her personal life private.

programme.title: Metal Shifters
programme.desc: After a meteorite crashes to Earth, a bacteria is released that kills humans on contact. When the bacteria latches on to an iron statue, it brings the statue to life to send it on a destructive rampage.

programme.title: Once Were Brothers: Robbie Robertson and The Band
programme.desc: The story of a band that went from backing up Bob Dylan to becoming one of the most influential groups of its era.

programme.title: Devotion
programme.desc: The story of Jesse Brown, the first Black aviator in Navy history, and fellow fighter pilot Tom Hudner. Helping to turn the tide in the Korean War's most brutal battle, their heroic sacrifices ultimately make them the Navy's most celebrated wingmen.

programme.title: The Amazing Maurice
programme.desc: Maurice is a streetwise ginger cat who comes up with a money-making scam by befriending a group of talking rats. However, when Maurice and the rodents reach the town of Bad Blintz, their little con soon goes down the drain.

programme.title: Unsung Hero
programme.desc: David Smallbone moves his family to the United States to search for a brighter future. Struggling to make ends meet, he soon realizes the talents of his children, who go on to become two of the most successful acts in contemporary Christian music.

programme.title: Monster
programme.desc: A single mother demands answers from a school teacher when her son begins acting strangely. A fight at school causes even more trouble.

programme.title: The Pod Generation
programme.desc: In the not-so-distant future, amid a society madly in love with technology, tech giant Pegazus offers couples the opportunity to share their pregnancies via detachable artificial wombs or pods. Rachel and Alvy's wild ride to parenthood begins.

programme.title: Dark Side of the Ring
programme.desc: Just three years post-9/11, Marc Copani sees the highs and lows of wrestling when he's given the chance to portray Muhammad Hassan, a villainous Arab-American character for the WWE.

programme.title: Alien: Romulus
programme.desc: Space colonizers come face to face with the most terrifying life-form in the universe while scavenging the deep ends of a derelict space station.

programme.title: Something You Said Last Night
programme.desc: An aspiring writer in her twenties, Ren and her younger sister Siena reluctantly accompany their parents on a family vacation. Siena parties all night long, but the more reserved Ren is left to her own devices.

programme.title: Daniel's Gotta Die
programme.desc: After his father's death, Daniel's plan to reconnect with his family hits a snag when he discovers they all want to kill him to claim the inheritance.

programme.title: Chris Redd: Why Am I Like This?
programme.desc: Chris Redd digs into his days of living life like a music video and realizing that even if he'll never be tall enough to dunk, he can still grow as a person.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Blue Devils (12-2, 4-0) host the Panthers (12-2, 3-0) for an ACC contest. Last season, Pittsburgh scored just its third win in 14 tries against Duke since joining the ACC. Duke has won eight in a row, while Pitt has claimed five straight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Blue Devils (13-2, 5-0 ACC) host the Fighting Irish (7-8, 1-3). Duke has won nine in a row overall, and is 11-1 versus Notre Dame since 2016-17 after winning a pair last season by a combined 26 points. The Irish have dropped three straight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Men's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Freshman sensation Cooper Flagg and the No. 2 Blue Devils (16-2, 8-0 ACC) visit the Demon Deacons (15-4, 7-1). Duke has won 12 straight games. Flagg, a 6-foot-9 guard, averages team highs of 19.2 points, 8.1 rebounds and 4.1 assists per outing.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Blue Devils entertain the Wolfpack in ACC play. Duke is 11-0 at home this season, with freshman sensation Cooper Flagg averaging 18 points per game. NC State has won its last two contests against Duke, in the 2024 ACC and NCAA Tournaments.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cooper Flagg gets his first taste of the Duke-North Carolina rivalry as his No. 2 Blue Devils host. Flagg has been the driving force behind Duke's 14-game win streak. The freshman leads the Blue Devils in points, rebounds, assists, and blocks.

programme.title: Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball
programme.desc: Adolph Rupp comes to the University of Kentucky in 1930, two years before the SEC is formed, and his Wildcats go on to dominate play in the conference for decades. Meanwhile, a future coaching legend later known as Pat Summitt is born in Tennessee.

programme.title: Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball
